abstract_summ: The pooled positive rate of the CT imaging was 89.76% and 90.35% when only including thin-section chest CT.MATERIALS AND METHODS A total of 22 patients of the 156 reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction confirmed COVID-19 patients who were hospitalized between March 27, 2020 and March 31, 2020 at our quaternary care academic medical center and who underwent CT imaging within 1 week of admission were included in this retrospective study.The incidences were highest in the right lower lobe (87.21%), left lower lobe (81.41%), and bilateral lower lobes (65.22%).CONCLUSIONS: The detection of COVID-19 chest CT imaging is very high among symptomatic individuals at high risk, especially using thin-section chest CT.The sensitivity of CT scan in confirmed patients under 18 years old was only 66% (95% CI, 0.11-1.00).
title_summ: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) CT Findings: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysisCT Quantitative Analysis and Its Relationship with Clinical Features for Assessing the Severity of Patients with COVID-19CT manifestations and clinical characteristics of 1115 patients with coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19): A systematic review and meta-analysisCoronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) imaging reporting and data system (COVID-RADS) and common lexicon: a proposal based on the imaging data of 37 studiesComparison of the computed tomography findings in COVID-19 and other viral pneumonia in immunocompetent adults: a systematic review and meta-analysisA Meta-analysis of 19 TrialsChest Computed Tomography for the Diagnosis of Patients with Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19): A Rapid Review and Meta-AnalysisChest computed tomography for the diagnosis of patients with coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19): a rapid review and meta-analysis.Detection of Unsuspected Coronavirus Disease 2019 Cases by Computed Tomography and Retrospective Implementation of the Radiological Society of North America/Society of Thoracic Radiology/American College of Radiology Consensus Guidelines.Meta-analysis of chest CT features of patients with COVID-19 pneumonia.The Chest CT Features of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in China:
title_abstract_phrases: The pooled positive rate of the CT imaging was 89.76% and 90.35% when only including thin-section chest CT.MATERIALS AND METHODS A total of 22 patients of the 156 reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction confirmed COVID-19 patients who were hospitalized between March 27, 2020 and March 31, 2020 at our quaternary care academic medical center and who underwent CT imaging within 1 week of admission were included in this retrospective study.The incidences were highest in the right lower lobe (87.21%), left lower lobe (81.41%), and bilateral lower lobes (65.22%).CONCLUSIONS: The detection of COVID-19 chest CT imaging is very high among symptomatic individuals at high risk, especially using thin-section chest CT.The Chest CT Features of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in China: A Meta-analysis of 19 TrialsObjective: This study aimed to summarize the characteristics of chest CT imaging in Chinese patients with Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) to provide reliable evidence for further guiding clinical routine.
